name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

string.description: The access key provided by Twitter.
string.caption: Access Key
string.name: accessKey

string.description: The access secret provided by Twitter.
string.caption: Access Secret
string.name: accessSecret

string.description: The consumer key used by this application.
string.caption: Consumer Key
string.name: consumerKey

string.description: The consumer key secret by this application.
string.caption: Consumer Secret
string.name: consumerSecret

boolean.description: Whether to use SSL in API calls to Twitter.
boolean.caption: Use SSL
boolean.name: useSSL

string.description: Proxy host.
string.caption: Proxy Host
string.name: proxyHost

integer.description: Proxy port.
integer.caption: Proxy Port
integer.name: proxyPort

string.description: Proxy username.
string.caption: Proxy Username
string.name: proxyUsername

mode.modeLabel: Get retweeted by user by screen name
Get retweeted by user by user id
Get retweeted to user by screen name
Get retweeted to user by user id
Get user timeline by screen name
Get user timeline by user id
Send direct message by screen name
Send direct message by user id

globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.
globalRef.caption: Config Reference
globalRef.name: config-ref

string.description: Restricts tweets to the given language, given by an ISO 639-1 code.
string.caption: Lang
string.name: lang

string.description: Specify the language of the query you are sending (only ja is currently effective). This is intended for language-specific clients and the default should work in the majority of cases.
string.caption: Locale
string.name: locale

string.description: The search query.
string.caption: Query
string.name: query

integer.description: If specified, returns tweets with status ids less than the given id.
integer.caption: Max Id
integer.name: maxId

integer.description: Sets the page number (starting at 1) to return, up to a max of roughly 1500 results.
integer.caption: Page
integer.name: page

integer.description: Sets the number of tweets to return per page, up to a max of 100.
integer.caption: Rpp
integer.name: rpp

string.description: If specified, returns tweets since the given date. Date should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.
string.caption: Since
string.name: since

integer.description: Returns tweets with status ids greater than the given id.
integer.caption: Since Id
integer.name: sinceId

string.description: A containing the latitude and longitude separated by ','. Used to get the tweets by users located within a given radius of the given latitude/longitude, where the user's location is taken from their Twitter profile.
string.caption: Geocode
string.name: geocode

string.description: The radius to be used in the geocode -ONLY VALID IF A GEOCODE IS GIVEN-.
string.caption: Radius
string.name: radius

string.description: If specified, returns tweets included popular or real time or both in the responce. Both by default. Can be 'mixed', 'popular' or 'recent'.
string.caption: Result Type
string.name: resultType

string.description: The unit of measurement of the given radius. Can be 'mi' or 'km'. Miles by default.
string.caption: Unit
string.name: unit

string.description: If specified, returns tweets with generated before the given date. Date should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.
string.caption: Until
string.name: until

integer.description: Specifies the page of results to retrieve.
integer.caption: Page
integer.name: page

integer.description: Specifies the number of records to retrieve. Must be less than or equal to 200.
integer.caption: Count
integer.name: count

integer.description: Returns results with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID. There are limits to the number of Tweets which can be accessed through the API. If the limit of Tweets has occured since the since_id, the since_id will be forced to the oldest ID available.
integer.caption: Since Id
integer.name: sinceId

cloud-connector.caption: Get User Timeline By Screen Name

string.description: The screen name of the user for whom to return results for.
string.caption: Screen Name
string.name: screenName

integer.description: Specifies the page of results to retrieve.
integer.caption: Page
integer.name: page

integer.description: Specifies the number of tweets to try and retrieve, up to a maximum of 200. The value of count is best thought of as a limit to the number of tweets to return because suspended or deleted content is removed after the count has been applied.
integer.caption: Count
integer.name: count

integer.caption: Since Id
integer.name: sinceId

integer.description: The numerical ID of the status you're trying to retrieve.
integer.caption: Id
integer.name: id

string.description: The text of your status update.
string.caption: Status
string.name: status

integer.description: The ID of an existing status that the update is in reply to.
integer.caption: In Reply To
integer.name: inReplyTo

string.description: The latitude of the location this tweet refers to. This parameter will be ignored unless it is inside the range -90.0 to +90.0 (North is positive) inclusive.
string.caption: Latitude
string.name: latitude

string.description: He longitude of the location this tweet refers to. The valid ranges for longitude is -180.0 to +180.0 (East is positive) inclusive. This parameter will be ignored if outside that range or if there not a corresponding lat parameter.
string.caption: Longitude
string.name: longitude

string.caption: Ip

string.caption: Id
string.name: id

string.description: The place_id within which the new place can be found. Try and be as close as possible with the containing place. For example, for a room in a building, set the contained_within as the building place_id.
string.caption: Contained Within
string.name: containedWithin

string.description: The name a place is known as.
string.caption: Name
string.name: name

string.description: The token found in the response from geo/similar_places.
string.caption: Token
string.name: token

string.description: Optional: This parameter searches for places which have this given street address. There are other well-known, and application specific attributes available. Custom attributes are also permitted. Learn more about Place Attributes.
string.caption: Street Address
string.name: streetAddress

string.name: latitude

string.caption: Longitude
string.name: longitude

string.caption: Latitude
string.name: latitude

string.description: The longitude.
string.caption: Longitude
string.name: longitude

integer.description: The WOEID of the location to be querying for.
integer.caption: Woeid
integer.name: woeid

string.description: Starting date of daily trends. If no date is specified, current date is used.
string.caption: Date
string.name: date

string.caption: Date
string.name: date

boolean.description: If all hashtags should be removed from the trends list.
boolean.caption: Exclude Hash Tags
boolean.name: excludeHashTags

endpoint.description:
Asynchronously retrieves public statuses that match one or more filter predicates.
At least a keyword or userId must be specified. Multiple parameters may be specified.
Placing long parameters in the URL may cause the request to be rejected for excessive URL length.
The default access level allows up to 200 track keywords and 400 follow userids.
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
endpoint.caption: Filtered Stream

integer.description: The number of previous statuses to stream before transitioning to the live stream.
integer.caption: Count
integer.name: count

global-endpoint.description:
Asynchronously retrieves public statuses that match one or more filter predicates.
At least a keyword or userId must be specified. Multiple parameters may be specified.
Placing long parameters in the URL may cause the request to be rejected for excessive URL length.
The default access level allows up to 200 track keywords and 400 follow userids.
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
global-endpoint.caption: Filtered Stream

endpoint.description:
Asynchronously retrieves a random sample of all public statuses. The sample size and quality varies depending on the account permissions
The default access level provides a small proportion of the Firehose. The "Gardenhose" access level provides a proportion more suitable for data mining and research applications that desire a larger proportion to be statistically significant sample.
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
endpoint.caption: Sample Stream

global-endpoint.description:
Asynchronously retrieves a random sample of all public statuses. The sample size and quality varies depending on the account permissions
The default access level provides a small proportion of the Firehose. The "Gardenhose" access level provides a proportion more suitable for data mining and research applications that desire a larger proportion to be statistically significant sample.
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
global-endpoint.caption: Sample Stream

endpoint.description:
Asynchronously retrieves all public statuses. This stream is not generally available - it requires special permissions and its usage is discouraged by Twitter
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
endpoint.caption: Firehose Stream

integer.description: Indicates the number of previous statuses to consider for delivery before transitioning to live stream delivery.
integer.caption: Count
integer.name: count

global-endpoint.description:
Asynchronously retrieves all public statuses. This stream is not generally available - it requires special permissions and its usage is discouraged by Twitter
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
global-endpoint.caption: Firehose Stream

endpoint.description:
Asynchronously retrieves all statuses containing 'http:' and 'https:'. Like Firehorse, its is not a generally available stream
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
endpoint.caption: Link Stream

integer.description: Indicates the number of previous statuses to consider for delivery before transitioning to live stream delivery.
integer.caption: Count
integer.name: count

global-endpoint.description:
Asynchronously retrieves all statuses containing 'http:' and 'https:'. Like Firehorse, its is not a generally available stream
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
global-endpoint.caption: Link Stream

endpoint.description:
Retrieves the following user updates notifications: - New Statuses - Block/Unblock events - Follow events - User profile updates - Retweets - List creation/deletion - List member addition/remotion - List subscription/unsubscription - List updates - Profile updates
Such notifications are represented as org.mule.twitter.UserEvent objects
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
endpoint.caption: User Stream

string-list.description: The keywords to track for new statuses.
string-list.caption: Keywords

global-endpoint.description:
Retrieves the following user updates notifications: - New Statuses - Block/Unblock events - Follow events - User profile updates - Retweets - List creation/deletion - List member addition/remotion - List subscription/unsubscription - List updates - Profile updates
Such notifications are represented as org.mule.twitter.UserEvent objects
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
global-endpoint.caption: User Stream

endpoint.description:
Asynchronously retrieves statutes for a set of supplied user's ids. Site Streams are a beta service, so refer always to latest twitter documentation about them.
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
endpoint.caption: Site Stream

string-list.description: Ids of users to include in the stream.
string-list.caption: User Ids

boolean.description: WithFollowings whether to receive status updates from people following.
boolean.caption: With Followings
boolean.name: withFollowings

global-endpoint.description:
Asynchronously retrieves statutes for a set of supplied user's ids. Site Streams are a beta service, so refer always to latest twitter documentation about them.
Only one Twitter stream can be consumed using the same credentials. As a consequence, only one twitter stream can be consumed per connector instance. .
global-endpoint.caption: Site Stream
